div.head: ¶ To my Honoured friend, Sir John Scot, Knight.
div.p:
TO keepe fresh the memorie of the mercie heerein expressed, I haue put these two Sermons into this way of suruiuing with posteritie, here is our Semination in prayers: and our Haruest in preuailings. Heere is Gods Semination in his benefite of
raine: and his Haruest our deuout Thankesgiuing. These I haue made bolde to communicate to the Church of God vnder your wel knowne and welbeloued name, as an acknowledgement of my debt to your loue of mee, who in short time haue learned to be euer bound vnto you. Deptford.
